books.title: Meditations
books.subtitle: Penguin Classics Edition
books.author: Marcus Aurelius
books.description: Stoic reflections by the Roman emperor on virtue, reason, and how to live a good life; one of the foundational texts of Stoic philosophy.

books.title: The Republic
books.subtitle: Oxford World's Classics
books.author: Plato
books.description: Plato’s dialogue on justice, the ideal city, and the philosopher-king; a cornerstone of Western political philosophy.

books.title: Nicomachean Ethics
books.subtitle: Penguin Classics
books.author: Aristotle
books.description: Aristotle’s account of ethical virtue, happiness (eudaimonia), and the doctrine of the mean, shaping virtue ethics.

books.title: The Social Contract
books.subtitle: Penguin Classics
books.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
books.description: Rousseau’s argument that political authority rests on a social pact and the general will; a seminal work in political theory.

books.title: Discourse on Method and Meditations on First Philosophy
books.subtitle: Modern Library
books.author: René Descartes
books.description: Descartes’ classic presentations of methodological doubt, cogito, and the foundations of modern epistemology.

books.title: Leviathan
books.subtitle: Penguin Classics
books.author: Thomas Hobbes
books.description: Hobbes’ defense of absolute sovereignty as the remedy for the state of nature; a foundational text in political philosophy.

books.title: An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding
books.subtitle: Oxford World's Classics
books.author: David Hume
books.description: Hume’s influential work on empiricism, causation, induction, and skepticism about metaphysics and religion.

books.title: A Treatise of Human Nature
books.subtitle: Oxford World's Classics
books.author: David Hume
books.description: Hume’s systematic attempt to apply the experimental method to human psychology, knowledge, and morality.

books.title: Ethics
books.subtitle: Penguin Classics
books.author: Benedict de Spinoza
books.description: Spinoza’s geometric presentation of metaphysics and ethics, arguing for a monist substance and intellectual love of God.

books.title: Critique of Pure Reason
books.subtitle: Cambridge Edition (Guyer & Wood)
books.author: Immanuel Kant
books.description: Kant’s monumental investigation into the limits and structure of human cognition, establishing transcendental idealism.

books.title: Groundwork of the Metaphysics of Morals
books.subtitle: Cambridge Texts in the History of Philosophy
books.author: Immanuel Kant
books.description: Kant’s concise statement of the categorical imperative and the basis of deontological ethics.

books.title: Critique of Practical Reason
books.subtitle: Oxford World's Classics
books.author: Immanuel Kant
books.description: Kant’s development of moral philosophy and freedom, complementing the Groundwork.

books.title: Critique of the Power of Judgment
books.subtitle: Oxford World's Classics
books.author: Immanuel Kant
books.description: Kant’s account of aesthetic and teleological judgment, bridging nature and freedom.

books.title: Beyond Good and Evil
books.subtitle: Oxford World's Classics
books.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
books.description: Nietzsche’s critique of traditional morality and metaphysics, introducing will to power and perspectivism.

books.title: Thus Spoke Zarathustra
books.subtitle: Penguin Classics
books.author: Friedrich Nietzsche
books.description: Nietzsche’s poetic-philosophical work on the Übermensch, eternal recurrence, and revaluation of values.

books.title: Phenomenology of Spirit
books.subtitle: Oxford/Blackwell Edition
books.author: G. W. F. Hegel
books.description: Hegel’s dialectical journey of consciousness toward absolute knowing; pivotal in German idealism.

books.title: Being and Nothingness
books.subtitle: A Phenomenological Essay on Ontology
books.author: Jean-Paul Sartre
books.description: Sartre’s major work in existentialism and phenomenology, exploring freedom, bad faith, and being-for-others.

books.title: The Myth of Sisyphus
books.subtitle: And Other Essays
books.author: Albert Camus
books.description: Camus articulates the absurd condition and proposes revolt as a response; a classic of existentialist thought.

books.title: Philosophical Investigations
books.subtitle: 4th Edition
books.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
books.description: Wittgenstein’s later philosophy of language and mind, emphasizing meaning as use and language-games.

books.title: Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus
books.subtitle: Oxford World's Classics
books.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein
books.description: A terse treatise on logic, language, and the limits of what can be said; central to analytic philosophy.

books.title: Discipline and Punish
books.subtitle: The Birth of the Prison
books.author: Michel Foucault
books.description: Foucault’s genealogy of modern punishment, surveillance, and the production of disciplined subjects.

books.title: The Order of Things
books.subtitle: An Archaeology of the Human Sciences
books.author: Michel Foucault
books.description: A structural analysis of knowledge systems that shaped the human sciences from the Renaissance to modernity.

books.title: The Human Condition
books.subtitle: University of Chicago Press
books.author: Hannah Arendt
books.description: Arendt’s analysis of the vita activa—labor, work, action—and the condition of modern public life.

books.title: The Ethics of Ambiguity
books.subtitle: Beacon Press
books.author: Simone de Beauvoir
books.description: De Beauvoir’s existentialist ethics arguing freedom must be exercised in awareness of others’ freedom.

books.title: Being and Nothingness
books.subtitle: Routledge Classics
books.author: Jean-Paul Sartre
books.description: Sartre’s existentialist masterpiece, exploring consciousness, freedom, bad faith, and interpersonal relationships.

books.title: The Myth of Sisyphus
books.subtitle: Vintage Edition
books.author: Albert Camus
books.description: Camus articulates the absurd condition and proposes revolt as the proper human response.

books.title: Language, Truth and Logic
books.subtitle: Routledge Classics
books.author: A. J. Ayer
books.description: Ayer’s classic defense of logical positivism asserting meaningful statements are either analytic or verifiable.

books.title: Word and Object
books.subtitle: MIT Press Edition
books.author: W. V. O. Quine
books.description: Quine’s classic on ontology, translation indeterminacy, and critique of the analytic–synthetic distinction.

books.title: Naming and Necessity
books.subtitle: Blackwell
books.author: Saul A. Kripke
books.description: Kripke’s groundbreaking lectures on reference, modal logic, and metaphysical necessity; introducing rigid designators.

books.title: The Structure of Scientific Revolutions
books.subtitle: 50th Anniversary Edition
books.author: Thomas S. Kuhn
books.description: Kuhn’s paradigm-shift model of scientific change, reshaping philosophy of science.

books.title: Conjectures and Refutations
books.subtitle: Routledge Edition
books.author: Karl Popper
books.description: Popper’s essays on falsifiability and the critical method in science and beyond.

books.title: Philosophy and the Mirror of Nature
books.subtitle: Princeton Classics
books.author: Richard Rorty
books.description: Rorty’s critique of epistemology and metaphysics, advocating pragmatism and anti-representationalism.

books.title: After Virtue
books.subtitle: Third Edition
books.author: Alasdair MacIntyre
books.description: MacIntyre’s critique of modern moral theory and defense of Aristotelian virtue ethics after an era of emotivism.

books.title: Ethics: A Very Short Introduction
books.author: Simon Blackburn
books.description: Clear overview of major ethical theories—deontology, utilitarianism, virtue ethics—by a leading analytic philosopher.

books.title: An Introduction to Metaphysics
books.author: Martin Heidegger
books.description: Heidegger’s essays exploring being, metaphysics, and the question of Being.

books.title: The Rodezer Lectures: What Is Philosophy?
books.author: Martin Heidegger
books.description: Heidegger’s accessible introduction to the nature and purpose of philosophy.

books.title: The Concept of Mind
books.subtitle: Oxford University Press
books.author: Gilbert Ryle
books.description: Ryle’s critique of Cartesian mind–body dualism, introducing the idea of ‘category mistake’.

books.title: Philosophy and Public Affairs
books.author: John Rawls
books.description: Collection of Rawls’s essays on justice, political liberalism, and theory of the well-ordered society.
